creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
markings: round symbol and '98 impression near base on one side
text: Suzuki Osamu cofounded the Kyoto-based avant-garde group Sōdeisha in 1948. These young artists were dedicated to exploring new ceramic styles and techniques that rejected traditional forms. Suzuki became one of the pioneers of abstract ceramic art in Japan, and from the mid-1950s he focused on sculpture.
title: Clay Image: One Branch
